definition: to pray/to pray for sth/to wish sth/prayer/wish

sentences.english: Pray or ask for the long life of masters.
sentences.chinese: 祈願或請求上師長壽住世。

sentences.english: In 2011, May all friends practice Dharma with determination.
sentences.chinese: 2011年，祈願法友們以堅定力學習佛法。

sentences.english: Here I pray for them for health.
sentences.chinese: 在此祈願健康重新相伴她們。

sentences.english: This is the prayer of the individual to the universal life.
sentences.chinese: 這是個人對宇宙生活的祈願。

sentences.english: I hope this article will help to the law of investment fund that is being formulated.
sentences.chinese: 祈願本文能對我國投資基金法的制定有所啓示。

sentences.english: I pray fervently for everyone I've failed to pray for in weeks.
sentences.chinese: 一週七天每天我都爲衆生祈願。

sentences.english: A hundred longevity in 100 words actually be meticulously carved in stone, wishes for health and longevity.
sentences.chinese: 百個壽字以百種寫法被精心雕於石上，祈願健康長壽。

sentences.english: Look at the Birds of Prey.
My prayers are not only wishing and asking, but they must be believing and accepting.
sentences.chinese: 我的禱告不但是祈願與請求，而且必須相信且接受。

sentences.english: Prayer Dafa will host over by Sang Phu or Karma Lama as a faction.
sentences.chinese: 祈願大法會的主持人改由桑浦寺或噶瑪派的喇嘛擔任。
請求您接受我們至誠的祈願。

sentences.english: Like traditional monasteries, residents spent much of their time in prayer and supplication.
sentences.chinese: 和傳統修道院一樣，信徒大部分時間是在祈禱和祈願。

definition: to make a wish/to make a vow/to promise a reward
favorable weather (idiom); good weather for crops
to supply/to provide for one's elders/to support one's parents
the country prospers, the people at peace (idiom); peace and prosperity
